programme.title: Sunderland vs. Newcastle United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Sunderland are unbeaten in their last nine league games against Newcastle, with this the first such Tyne/Wear derby since a 1-1 draw at St James’ Park in March 2016. Newcastle have lost their last three away league games against Sunderland, more than they had in their previous 21 visits combined. They’ve never lost four in a row at the Mackems before.

programme.title: Liverpool vs. Brighton and Hove Albion - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Liverpool have lost just one of their eight Premier League home games against Brighton, though it was the only other time they’ve faced them as the competition’s reigning champions. Brighton beat Liverpool 3-2 in their last meeting in May but have never beaten the Reds in consecutive league matches before.

programme.title: Arsenal vs. Wolverhampton Wanderers - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Arsenal winger Noni Madueke has scored four goals in his two Premier League starts against Wolves, including a hat-trick for Chelsea at Molineux last season. 12 of Arsenal’s first 17 Premier League goals this season had come from set piece situations. Since Viktor Gyokeres’ header at Burnley in November, the Gunners’ last 11 league goals have all been from open play.

programme.desc: Villarreal have won four of their last eight LaLiga matches against Real Betis, but three of those wins have come away from home. programme.title: Deportivo Alaves vs Real Madrid - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 16 - Mini Match
programme.desc: FC Barcelona have won their last two LaLiga matches against Girona FC, both since Hansi Flick took charge, after failing to win any of their previous three – they could now record three consecutive wins against them for the first time in the competition. Girona have scored points in three of their five LaLiga away games against Barcelona, although they suffered their heaviest defeat in the competition in one of those matches, a 6-1 defeat in February 2018.

programme.title: Internazionale Milano vs Liverpool - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Internazionale and Liverpool have faced each other on six previous occasions – all in the European Cup/UEFA Champions League – with the Reds winning four of the six to date. Five of the last six meetings between Internazionale and Liverpool have seen one of the sides win and keep a clean sheet. Indeed, not since their first meeting in May 1965 have both sides scored in this fixture.

programme.title: Athletic Club vs Paris Saint-Germain - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Athletic Club and Paris SG have met twice previously in European competition, with both sides winning their home match in the group stage of the 2011-12 UEFA Europa League. Paris SG have won each of their last three away games against Spanish sides in major European competition, all within the last three seasons. This is as many victories as they managed across their previous 13 away games against Spanish opponents in major European competition combined.

programme.title: Olympique Marseille vs Monaco - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 16

Atalanta vs Chelsea - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Atalanta and Chelsea will meet for the first time in European competition, while the Italian side have only won one of their previous seven games against English sides in the UEFA Champions League. This will be Chelsea’s first away game against an Italian opponent since October 2022, in a 2-0 victory away to Milan. Prior to that game, the Blues had only won one of their first 10 matches away to Italian sides in the UEFA Champions League : 4-0 v Lazio in November 2003.

programme.title: Barcelona vs Eintracht Frankfurt - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Barcelona have failed to win either of their two meetings against Eintracht Frankfurt to date, with both of those coming in the UEFA Europa League semi-finals in 2021-22. Ahead of the third meeting between Barcelona and Eintracht Frankfurt, the Catalan side have only faced two other opponents as many as three times in European competition without recording a victory: Dundee United and Strasbourg.

programme.title: Internazionale Milano vs Liverpool - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Internazionale and Liverpool have faced each other on six previous occasions – all in the European Cup/UEFA Champions League – with the Reds winning four of the six to date. Five of the last six meetings between Internazionale and Liverpool have seen one of the sides win and keep a clean sheet. Indeed, not since their first meeting in May 1965 have both sides scored in this fixture.

programme.title: Atalanta vs Chelsea - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Atalanta and Chelsea will meet for the first time in European competition, while the Italian side have only won one of their previous seven games against English sides in the UEFA Champions League. This will be Chelsea’s first away game against an Italian opponent since October 2022, in a 2-0 victory away to Milan. Prior to that game, the Blues had only won one of their first 10 matches away to Italian sides in the UEFA Champions League : 4-0 v Lazio in November 2003.

PSV Eindhoven vs Atletico de Madrid - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: PSV are winless in six meetings with Atletico Madrid, making them the opponent they have faced most in European competition without managing a single victory. PSV have only scored one goal in six UEFA Champions League matches against Atletico Madrid. Among teams with 5+ games against an opponent in the competition, only Club Brugge versus Borussia Dortmund have a lower goals per game ratio.

programme.title: Union Saint-Gilloise vs Olympique de Marseille - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: The previous meetings between Union Saint-Gilloise and Marseille came 63 years ago, with the Belgian side eliminating their opponents in the first round of the 1962-63 Inter-Cities Fairs Cup. Union Saint-Gilloise were the first ever opponent that Marseille faced in European competition, doing so in September/October 1962. Since their last meeting, the French side have played a further 276 games in European competition.

programme.title: Tottenham Hotspur vs Slavia Praha - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: All four of the previous meetings between Tottenham and Slavia Prague came in the UEFA Cup between 2006 and 2008, with the English side unbeaten across four matches. Slavia Prague have only won two of their previous 16 games against English sides in Europe, with those two victories coming in the UEFA Cup/Europa League. They’re winless in three against English teams in the UEFA Champions League.

programme.title: PSV Eindhoven vs Atletico de Madrid - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: PSV are winless in six meetings with Atletico Madrid, making them the opponent they have faced most in European competition without managing a single victory. PSV have only scored one goal in six UEFA Champions League matches against Atletico Madrid. Among teams with 5+ games against an opponent in the competition, only Club Brugge versus Borussia Dortmund have a lower goals per game ratio.

programme.desc: Villarreal and Copenhagen will meet for the first time here, with the Yellow Submarine only facing one other Danish side in major European competition previously. Copenhagen have played more games without winning against teams from Spain than against those from any other nation in European competition, drawing six and losing nine of their 15 such matches.

programme.title: Athletic Club vs Paris Saint-Germain - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Athletic Club and Paris SG have met twice previously in European competition, with both sides winning their home match in the group stage of the 2011-12 UEFA Europa League. Paris SG have won each of their last three away games against Spanish sides in major European competition, all within the last three seasons. This is as many victories as they managed across their previous 13 away games against Spanish opponents in major European competition combined.

Bayer Leverkusen vs Newcastle United - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: The previous meetings between Bayer Leverkusen and Newcastle came in the 2002-03 UEFA Champions League campaign, with the Magpies winning 3-1 both home and away against them that season. Newcastle are winless in their last three games against German sides in European competition, with both of those defeats coming under Eddie Howe: 0-1 at home and 0-2 away versus Borussia Dortmund in the 2023-24 UEFA Champions League.

programme.title: Borussia Dortmund vs Bodø/Glimt - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Borussia Dortmund haven’t faced Bodø/Glimt before, but have lost just one of their six overall matches against Norwegian opposition in Europe : 0-3 v Rosenborg in October 1999 in the UEFA Champions League. This will be just the second European campaign in which Bodø/Glimt have faced a German opponent, after two winless meetings with Werder Bremen in the first round of the 1999-2000 UEFA Cup.

programme.title: Club Brugge vs Arsenal - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: Club Brugge have faced 12 different English sides in European competition, but this will be their first against Arsenal. The Belgian side have only won one of their last 18 matches against English opposition, although that win did come in the UEFA Champions League last term. Arsenal’s last defeat against a Belgian side came in October 1981, having gone unbeaten in their last nine such matches since then. They’re also unbeaten in their last four away matches against Belgian sides since that loss to KFC Winterslag in 1981.

programme.title: Juventus vs Pafos - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD6
programme.desc: This will be just the third fixture between Italian and Cypriot sides in the European Cup/UEFA Champions League, after Juventus v APOEL Nicosia in 1977-78 and Internazionale v Anorthosis Famagusta. programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. Expect tight time allowed, flowing lines, and smart tactics on stride counts and anchor placement as title contenders push for pole.

programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The decisive GCL Team Round 2. Reverse-order start from Round 1, with every rail and second counting toward the combined team total. Strategic rider swaps and cool heads over a technical track shape the podium and precious championship points in a high-stakes Roman finish.

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: Top combinations tackle elite CSI5* classes at the Foro Italico. A technical track, tight time allowed and related lines test precision and power, with the fastest clears advancing to a jump-off. Expect fine margins, inside turns and bold strides as riders chase ranking points and momentum for the Grand Prix.

programme.title: Grand Prix of Rome - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The 1.60m LGCT Grand Prix: one round plus jump-off for big championship points and a golden ticket to the Prague Playoffs Super Grand Prix. Huge oxers, delicate verticals and a demanding time allowed reward brave riding and perfect stride control in a high-stakes Roman finale.

programme.title: Road to Afcon Algeria
Evening Show - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
Nigeria vs Ivory Coast - Final - TotalEnergies CAF AFCON Cote dIvoire 2023
programme.desc: This is the second time Nigeria and Côte dIvoire will face in the 2023 CAF Africa Cup of Nations, following the 1-0 victory for the Super Eagles in the group stages. Côte dIvoire haven’t beaten them at AFCON since the 2008 group stages, a 1-0 win. Nigeria and Côte dIvoire are meeting for the eighth time at the Africa Cup of Nations, including in all three AFCON editions where the Super Eagles have won the competition.

programme.title: Nigeria vs Ivory Coast - Final - TotalEnergies CAF AFCON Cote dIvoire 2023
programme.desc: This is the second time Nigeria and Côte dIvoire will face in the 2023 CAF Africa Cup of Nations, following the 1-0 victory for the Super Eagles in the group stages. Côte dIvoire haven’t beaten them at AFCON since the 2008 group stages, a 1-0 win. Nigeria and Côte dIvoire are meeting for the eighth time at the Africa Cup of Nations, including in all three AFCON editions where the Super Eagles have won the competition.

programme.title: Special Coverage Arab Cup FIFA Qatar 2025
programme.desc: The second edition of the FIFA Arab Cup is scheduled to be held in Qatar from December 1 to 18, 2025. The tournament will be hosted across six venues, all of which were utilized during the FIFA World Cup™ three years prior. As with Qatar 2022, Al Bayt Stadium will host the tournaments opening match, while the prestigious Lusail Stadium will serve as the venue for the final. Stay updated with comprehensive coverage of the Arab Cup Qatar 2025 on BeIN Sports News.

programme.title: Fanes Atmosphere - Arab Cup FIFA Qatar 2025
programme.desc: The FIFA Arab Cup Qatar 2025 has successfully revived the vibrant festival atmosphere reminiscent of the World Cup in Qatar. The tournament has been transformed into an accessible, family-friendly public celebration through the implementation of large-scale fan zones, cultural activations, efficient transportation, and strategic promotions. A key element of this success is the establishment of numerous high-profile fan hubs, providing supporters with engaging spaces to gather well before kick-off.
